text: Elisabeth Ivanovna Steinberg (; 1884-1963) was a Russian botanist noted for studying the plants of North Asia, including Russia and Kazakhstan. She worked at Tomsk State University and St. Petersburg State University. During the siege of Leningrad in the Second World War, she was among those protecting the Peterhof Natural Science Institute. She identified at least 30 species. == References == Category:1884 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Russian women scientists Category:Russian botanists
title: Elisabeth Ivanovna Steinberg
